topics.body:
It's a bit hopeful of me, but I hope that in a year I'll be able to throw out all my guy clothing and full time as a woman.

The hair removal was a metaphorical bitch to do cause of how painful it was and losing 20 pounds will be hard to do, but after that it should be easy. . well easier.  I did it the smart way in that I did all the hard stuff first so that in a years time I'll be able to full time.

I'm just going to keep my hair this length cause it gets too frizzy the longer it is.  I would like long hair, but if it gets past my shoulders it just goes poof.

I'll come out to my family in six months cause while most of my family doesn't care my brother and sister are homophobic.  It's why I want gay marriage to be legalized so badly cause my brother is holding out on the hope that the anti-gay rights movement will make a comeback.  Nothing will change his mind, but it's smart; if he sees that the anti-gay rights movement has lost he'll at least wave the white flag.

Why I'm waiting six months to come out:
When gay marriage is legalized:
My brother and sister, "SON OF A-"
Six months later, "Well we've lost; we'll just have to accept it"
